Package com.marginallyclever.artPipeline.converters

Class ImageConverter

java.lang.Object
com.marginallyclever.artPipeline.ImageManipulator
com.marginallyclever.artPipeline.converters.ImageConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
MakelangeloRobotDecorator
Direct Known Subclasses:
Converter_Boxes, Converter_CannyEdge, Converter_CMYK, Converter_ColorBoxes, Converter_ColorFloodFill, Converter_Crosshatch, Converter_MagicCircle, Converter_Moire, Converter_Multipass, Converter_Pulse, Converter_RandomLines, Converter_Sandy, Converter_Spiral, Converter_Spiral_CMYK, Converter_SpiralPulse, Converter_VoronoiStippling, Converter_VoronoiZigZag, Converter_Wander, Converter_ZigZag
public abstract class ImageConverter
extends ImageManipulator
implements MakelangeloRobotDecorator
Converts a BufferedImage to gcode Image converters have to be listed in src/main/resources/META-INF/services/com.marginallyclever.makelangeloRobot.generators.ImageConverter in order to be found by the ServiceLoader. This is so that you could write an independent plugin and drop it in the same folder as makelangelo software to be "found" by the software. Don't forget http://www.reverb-marketing.com/wiki/index.php/When_a_new_style_has_been_added_to_the_Makelangelo_software
Author:
Dan Royer

    • finish

      public void finish()
      for "run once" converters, return do the entire conversion and write to disk. for iterative solvers, the iteration is now done, write to disk.

    • convertAlongLine

      protected void convertAlongLine​(double x0, double y0, double x1, double y1, double stepSize, double channelCutoff, TransformedImage img)
      Drag the pen across the paper from p0 to p1, sampling (p1-p0)/stepSize times. If the intensity of img at a sample location is greater than the channelCutff, raise the pen. Print the gcode results to out. This method is used by several converters.
      Parameters:
      x0 - starting position on the paper.
      y0 - starting position on the paper.
      x1 - ending position on the paper.
      y1 - ending position on the paper.
      stepSize - mm level of detail for this line.
      channelCutoff - only put pen down when color below this amount.
      img - the image to sample while converting along the line.

    • convertAlongLineErrorTerms

      protected void convertAlongLineErrorTerms​(double x0, double y0, double x1, double y1, double stepSize, double channelCutoff, double[] error0, double[] error1, TransformedImage img)
      Drag the pen across the paper from p0 to p1, sampling (p1-p0)/stepSize times. If the intensity of img at a sample location is greater than the channelCutff, raise the pen. Print the gcode results to out. This method is used by several converters.
      Parameters:
      x0 - starting position on the paper.
      y0 - starting position on the paper.
      x1 - ending position on the paper.
      y1 - ending position on the paper.
      stepSize - mm level of detail for this line.
      channelCutoff - only put pen down when color below this amount.
      img - the image to sample while converting along the line.
